conclusion: Analyze image to understand layout and flow of liquid through baffles.
Identify paths liquid can take from A, B, C, and D to containers E and F.
Determine which container liquid is most likely to flow into.
Image shows setup with points A, B, C, D connected to baffles directing flow to containers E and F.
Identify the liquid sources as labeled A, B, C, and D.
Baffles are positioned to direct liquid flow towards either container E or F.
Liquid from A flows through baffles towards container E.
Liquid from B flows through baffles towards container F.
Liquid from C flows through baffles towards container F.
Liquid from D flows through baffles towards container F.
Liquid from A goes to E, while liquid from B, C, and D goes to F.
Liquid from A will flow into container E, while liquid from B, C, and D will flow into container F.
